text: 1. CALL TO ORDER/FLAG SALUTE
2. APPROVAL OF MINUTES
Approval of minutes of the Regular Meeting of June 18, 2013 and the Special Meeting of
August 1, 2013
3. PUBLIC COMMENTS
The public may address the Board on any agenda item and any item not on the agenda.  The Board
president will only call on those who have filled out comment cards before the meeting, and each speaker
will be allotted three (3) minutes.  The Board will not respond or take action on any non-agenda item
comments at this time, although the item may be agendized at a later date (Ed. Code 35145.5).  The
comments shall be made from the podium.  In accordance with Government Code 54954.2 – No action or
discussion shall be undertaken on any item not appearing on the posted agenda.  The Board shall limit the
total time to 30 minutes.
4. CONSENT ITEMS
Consent items are considered to be routine by the Board of Education and will be enacted in one
motion.  If discussion of any of the items is required, they may be removed from Consent and
considered separately.
4.1   Ratification of the Personnel Report for August 2013
4.2   Ratification of Warrant List for June and July 2013
4.3   Adoption of Resolution No. 13-14-05 - Agreement for Employer Paid Member Contribution to
California State Teachers’ Retirement System (CalSTRS)
4.4   Approval of Supervised Fieldwork Agreements with Brandman University, CalStateTEACH,
Humboldt State University, Santa Clara University, and University of San Francisco
4.5    Adoption of Amended 2013-2014 Salary Schedules
Board Meeting Agenda August 20, 2013 Page 2
4.6    Approve the Reimbursement to Swinerton Management and Consulting in the Amount of
$151,156 for Construction Management Offices and Support Facilities
4.7    Adoption of Resolution No.13-14-04 – Recalculation of the 2012-2013 Appropriations
Limitation and Calculation of the Estimated 2013-2014 Appropriations Limitation
4.8    Approval of a Contract Award to Sensible Environmental Solutions (SES) in the Amount of
$163,270 to Provide Hazardous Material Inspection and Testing Services in Preparation for
Facility Modernization Projects at 16 Elementary Schools and 5 Middle Schools
4.9    Declaration of Surplus Property
4.10  Approval of the School Site Grants – PTA/PTO/Foundation Grants
4.11  Adoption of Resolution No. 13-14-02 – Local Agreement for Child Development Services for
State Preschool for 2013-2014 School Year
4.12  Approval of the School and Library Improvement Plans, 2013-2014
4.13  Approval of Contract with EMC Research for Survey and Opinion Analysis Services in an
Amount not to Exceed $27,000
5.  SUPERINTENDENT’S REPORT
6.  ACTION ITEMS
6.1   Adoption of Resolution No.13-14-03 -- Authorizing Election Under Public Contract Code
(Section 22030) to Become Subject to Uniform Public Construction Cost Accounting
Procedures
6.2   Approval of Contract with TBWB Strategies in the amount of $40,000 for Consulting Services
Regarding a Parcel Tax Renewal Measure in 2014
7. DISCUSSION/INFORMATION ITEMS
7.1    Update on the 2013-2014 Adopted State Budget and the Impact on the District’s Budget
Projections
7.2    Receive for Information an Update on the Progress of the Measure H Bond Program
7.3    Accept for Information the Quarterly Report on Williams Uniform Complaints
8. CLOSED SESSION
By law, closed sessions are not open to the public.  Anyone wishing to address the Board of
Education on closed session matters may do so during Agenda Item 4 – Public Comments.
8.1   Conference with Legal Counsel -- Existing Litigation (Subdivision (a) of
Section 54956.9): OAH Case No. 2013010989
8.2   Personnel Action- Discipline/Dismissal/Release (Gov. Code, § 54957)
9.  REPORT FROM CLOSED SESSION
10.  BOARD ACTIVITY
11.  ADJOURNMENT
